QAPair.Question: What is (are) Flank pain ?
QAPair.Answer: Flank pain is pain in one side of the body between the upper belly area (abdomen) and the back.

QAPair.Question: What to do for Flank pain ?
QAPair.Answer: Flank pain can be a sign of a kidney problem. But, since many organs are in this area, other causes are possible. If you have flank pain and fever, chills, blood in the urine, or frequent or urgent urination, then a kidney problem is the likely cause. It could be a sign of kidney stones .
